class="ItemGrouped ItemGrouped--business"><div class="Item L-4 Theme--news"><div class="Item-content"><h3 class="Item-headline Headline--xl"><a data-tracking='{"teaser_lead_text":"","article_flag":"no flag","event_navigation_name":"widget:article","article_parent_name":"article:sue gray sacking won’t fix ‘systemic’ no 10 issues, officials warn","section_details":"section:news"}' warn</a></h3><a data-tracking='{"teaser_lead_text":"","article_flag":"no flag","event_navigation_name":"widget:article","article_parent_name":"article:sue gray sacking won’t fix ‘systemic’ no 10 Item-dip"><span class="u-showOnWide">Sir Keir Starmer’s decision to sack his chief of staff will not resolve “systemic” issues in his No 10 operation and questions over his leadership, senior The prime minister is attempting to reboot his government by sacking Sue Gray only three months after the...</span><span class="u-showOnMedium">Sir Keir Starmer’s decision to sack his chief of staff will not resolve “systemic” issues in his No 10 operation and questions over his leadership, senior Whitehall figures have warned. The prime minister is attempting to reboot his government by sacking Sue Gray only three months after the...</span><span class="u-showOnSmall">Sir Keir Starmer’s decision to sack his chief of staff will not resolve “systemic” issues in his No 10 operation and questions...</span></p></a></div></div><div class="Item P-3 Theme--news"><div class="Item-content"><h3 class="Item-headline Headline--m"><a data-tracking='{"teaser_lead_text":"","article_flag":"no flag","event_navigation_name":"widget:article","article_parent_name":"article:peerages will need to be ‘justified’ in crackdown on cronyism","section_details":"section:news"}'  href="/uk/politics/article/house-of-lords-appointments-will-be-justified-to-curb-cronyism-gd7vgt3kz" class="js-tracking">Peerages will need to be ‘justified’ in crackdown on cronyism</a></h3><a data-tracking='{"teaser_lead_text":"","article_flag":"no flag","event_navigation_name":"widget:article","article_parent_name":"article:peerages will need to be ‘justified’ in crackdown on cronyism","section_details":"section:news"}'  href="/uk/politics/article/house-of-lords-appointments-will-be-justified-to-curb-cronyism-gd7vgt3kz" class="js-tracking"><p class="Dip Item-dip"><span class="u-showOnWide">Political parties will have to publicly justify why they are appointing peers to the House of Lords in an attempt to reduce “cronyism” in the second chamber. Under plans being drawn up by ministers, all future nominations for a peerage will have to be accompanied by a citation setting out the experience the candidate would bring to the role.</span><span class="u-showOnMedium">Political parties will have to publicly justify why they are appointing peers to the House of Lords in an attempt to reduce “cronyism” in the second chamber. Under plans being drawn up by ministers, all future nominations for a peerage will have to be accompanied by a citation setting out the experience the candidate would bring to the role.</span><span class="u-showOnSmall">Political parties will have to publicly justify why they are appointing peers to the House of Lords in an attempt to reduce...</span></p></a></div></div></div><div data-src="https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2Fef8049ec-f272-49d9-9184-d33a59c06bbb.jpg?crop=5000%2C2813%2C0%2C262&resize={width}" data-alt="" src="/d/img/DUR-masthead-40fe00731f.png" loading="lazy" alt="Daily Universal Slice Masthead" class="Slice-masthead"><h3 class="Label--panel">Daily Universal Register</h3></header><div class="ItemGrouped DUR-1"><div class="Item DUR-1"><h4 class="Item-label Label--panel">Briefing</h4><div class="Item-content"><div class="Dip Item-dip"><p><b>UK</b>: Third ballot in the Conservative Party leadership contest; National Grid publishes its estimate for winter energy use, based on long-range weather forecasts; the winners of the Wildlife Photographer of the Year awards are announced by the Natural History Museum in London.<br><b>Sweden</b>: The winner of the Nobel prize in physics is announced. </p> </div></div></div><div class="Item DUR-1"><h4 class="Item-label Label--panel">On this day</h4><div class="Item-content"><div class="Dip Item-dip"><p>In <b>1094</b> St Mark’s Basilica in Venice, Italy, was consecrated by Doge Vitale Falier, when the body believed to be of St Mark was placed in a marble tomb beneath the high altar; in<b> 1871 </b>the Great Fire of Chicagobegan, with 300 lives lost and the destruction of 17,000 buildings. According to folklore, the fire started after a cow kicked over a lit oil lamp in a barn; in <b>1952</b>, 108 passengers and four crew died when three trains collided at Harrow and Wealdstone, northwest London. Nearly 340 people were injured; in <b>1953</b> the musical play <i>The King and I</i> had its London premiere, at the Theatre Royal, Drury Lane. Herbert Lom starred as the King of Siam, with Valerie Hobson as Anna Leonowens; in <b>1965</b> the Post Office Tower (BT Tower) opened in London. At 189 metres high it was Britain’s tallest building until 1980, and now has listed building status.</p> </div></div></div></div><div class="Item DUR-2"><div class="Item-media"><img src="/d/img/DUR-nature-80d36dd1cd.png" loading="lazy" alt="Nature notes"></div><div class="Item-content"><h4 class="Item-headline Headline Headline--light Headline--m">Nature notes</h4><div class="ShowMore"><div class="Dip Item-dip Item-dip--withDropcap ShowMore-container js-showMore--dur2a is-hidden"><p>Despite the outpouring of grief when the Sycamore Gap tree was illegally felled, this naturalised non-native species is not generally well-loved. In fact, it’s regarded by many as a “junk” species due to the extraordinary fertility of its wind-borne samaras, which can carpet lawns and sports pitches in seedlings and allow it to outcompete other trees. Some also bemoan the sticky honeydew emitted by the aphids that feast on sycamores, but aphids are vital food for small birds such as blue tits and sparrows which are suffering from the decline in caterpillars during the breeding season. As we lose our ash trees, tough, unfussy, pioneering sycamores have a vital role to play in capturing carbon and creating new woodlands. <i>Melissa Harrison</i></p> <p class="Byline Byline-name">Melissa Harrison</p></div><div class="Section-footer "><div class="ButtonContainer js-buttonContainer"><button data-tracking='{"event_navigation_name":"button:show more","section_details":"section:nature notes","other_details":"content segment:2"}'  class="Button Button--expand Item-button js-buttonShowMore ShowMore-button js-tracking" data-identifier="dur2a">Show more</button></div></div></div></div></div><div class="Item DUR-2"><div class="Item-media"><img src="/d/img/DUR-birthdays-94b2272911.png" loading="lazy" alt="Birthdays"></div><div class="Item-content"><h4 class="Item-headline Headline Headline--light Headline--m">Birthdays today</h4><div class="ShowMore"><div class="Dip Item-dip ShowMore-container
